issue.description: Fields from a version of a Jira issue.
issue.$comment: Depends on gros/data-gathering jira_fields.json. All fields are strings for cross-compatibility with older importers.

changelog_id.description: Sequential number of the version of the issue.

issuetype.description: Identifier of the type of the issue.

priority.description: Identifier of the priority of the issue.

resolution.description: Identifier of the resolution of the issue.

fixVersions.description: Identifier of the first version in which the resolved issue is included.

versions.description: Identifier of the first affected version in which the issue is confirmed.

bugfix.description: Whether the issue is a bug fix.

approved.description: Whether the issue is approved by the team.

approved_by_po.description: Whether the issue is approved by the Product Owner.

watchers.description: Number of developers who follow updates of the issue.

created.description: Moment when the issue is created.

updated.description: Moment when the issue was changed for this version.

description.description: Jira-specific syntax-based description of the issue.

duedate.description: Day when the issue is targeted to be completed.

project.description: Project key of the project that the issue is in during this version.

status.description: Identifier of the status of the issue.

reporter.description: Account name of the developer who created or reported the issue.

assignee.description: Account name of the developer who is assigned to resolve the issue.

storypoint.description: Number of points assigned to an issue based on developer assessment of difficulty.

resolution_date.description: Moment when the issue is marked as resolved.

sprint.description: Identifier of the first sprint that the issue is worked in.

updated_by.description: Name of the developer who made the change to the issue for this version.

attachment.description: Number of files uploaded as attachments to the issue.

rank_change.description: Whether the issue was moved higer or lower on the backlog during this version. `-1` means ranked lower, `0` means no change, and `1` means ranked higher.

environment.description: Name of the environment that is affected by the issue.

epic.description: Key of an issue that acts as the epic, with more links to related issues. This is `0` if there is no related epic.

flagged.description: Whether the issue is marked as being blocked by an impediment. This is `0` if no flag is used, and `1` if the issue is flagged.

ready_status.description: Identifier of the ready status of the issue.

ready_status_reason.description: Description of the reason why the issue has the ready status.

labels.description: Number of labels provided to the issue.

external_project.description: Project key of the project that the issue is created for, when it is created on a support team board.

expected_ltcs.description: Number of logical test cases that are needed to sufficiently test the implementation of the issue's solution.

expected_phtcs.description: Number of physical test cases that are needed to sufficiently test the implementation of the issue's solution.

test_given.description: Description of a Given part of the test model for the test case.

test_when.description: Description of a When part of the test model for the test case.

test_then.description: Description of a Then part of the test model for the test case.

test_execution.description: Identifier of the test execution model for the issue.

test_execution_time.description: Units of time that the test execution for the issue takes.

encryption.description: Whether the personal information fields related to the reporter, assignee and updater are encrypted.
